intro: Petalostemon corymbosus, commonly known as the clustered pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, often pink or purple flowers that bloom in the spring. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shady areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological study.
